title: dist: provide binary tarballs for Linux/ARM
body:
See the discussion here:
https://groups.google.com/group/golang-nuts/browse_thread/thread/638d945789e6c0ff/27160e15fd9c072a?lnk=gst&;q=raspberry#27160e15fd9c072a

linux/arm is a very popular platform, and it's becoming increasingly so thanks to
projects like the RaspberryPi.

But it's unfortunately very hard to compile the go repository from the source in such
tiny computers. The compilation uses a lot of RAM and can take up to one hour.

It would be great if we could have a pre-built tarball with the go distribution.
